citeinfo.title: KauaiE_baseline - Offshore baseline used to cast shore-perpendicular transects for measurement of historical shoreline positions along East Kauai, Hawaii (Papaa to Nawiliwili)

pubinfo.pubplace: Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center, Woods Hole, MA

citeinfo.title: National Assessment of Shoreline Change: A GIS Compilation of Vector Shorelines and Associated Shoreline Change Data for the Sandy Shorelines of Kauai, Oahu, and Maui; Hawaii

pubinfo.pubplace: Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center, Woods Hole, MA
pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

descript.abstract:
Sandy ocean beaches are a popular recreational destination, often surrounded by communities containing valuable real estate. Development is on the rise despite the fact that coastal infrastructure is subjected to flooding and erosion. As a result, there is an increased demand for accurate information regarding past and present shoreline changes. To meet these national needs, the Coastal and Marine Geology Program of the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) is compiling existing reliable historical shoreline data along open-ocean sandy shores of the conterminous United States and parts of Alaska and Hawaii under the National Assessment of Shoreline Change project.
There is no widely accepted standard for analyzing shoreline change. Existing shoreline data measurements and rate calculation methods vary from study to study and prevent combining results into state-wide or regional assessments. The impetus behind the National Assessment project was to develop a standardized method of measuring changes in shoreline position that is consistent from coast to coast. The goal was to facilitate the process of periodically and systematically updating the results in an internally consistent manner.
descript.purpose:
This dataset includes reference baselines used by the Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) to calculate rate-of-change statistics for Kauai East region from Papaa to Nawiliwili. Transects were constructed manually outside of DSAS and later imported. However, these baselines are required to calculate shoreline change rates in DSAS using the manually-constructed transects. The transects intersect each shoreline and establish measurement points used to calculate shoreline-change rates.
Rates of long-term and short-term shoreline change were generated in a GIS using the DSAS version 4.2 - An ArcGIS extension for calculating shoreline change: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 2008-1278, Thieler, E.R., Himmelstoss, E.A., Zichichi, J.L., and Ergul, Ayhan.

citeinfo.title: National Assessment of Shoreline Change: Historical Shoreline Change in the Hawaiian Islands

pubinfo.pubplace: Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center, Woods Hole, MA

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) version 4.0 - An ArcGIS extension for calculating shoreline change
citeinfo.othercit: Current version of software at time of use was 4.2

attracc.attraccr: The attribute in this layer is based on the requirements for use within the Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) software (USGS Open-File Report 2008-1278). The data have been quality checked and the attribute value (ID) increments sequentially alongshore. The attribute value (ID) may not always increment sequentially offshore. Transects may cross seaward of historical shorelines resulting in non-sequential numbering offshore. This is done to maintain roughly equal spacing and perpendicular alignment of transects to shorelines on convex (embayed) coasts.

dataqual.logic: All polylines have a unique identification attribute (ID) used to designate the alongshore order of baselines. Adjacent baseline segments may overlap and are not necessarily continuous. Baseline segments may overlap to maintain roughly equal spacing and perpendicular alignment of transects (cast from the baselines) to historical shorelines on convex (embayed) coasts.
dataqual.complete: This baseline file is complete and contains all baseline segments for the East Kauai coastal region where shoreline data were available to calculate either a short- or long-term rate. Transects were constructed manually outside of DSAS and later imported. However, these baselines are required to calculate shoreline change rates in DSAS using the manually-constructed transects.

horizpa.horizpar: The baseline serves as a reference point for transects cast by the Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) software. It does not correspond to any real-world feature.

procstep.procdesc: A series of baseline segments were constructed offshore from the time series of shoreline positions using standard editing tools in ArcMap v.9.3. Baselines are provided to allow the user to replicate our rate calculations with DSAS v4.2 but transects cannot be re-cast in DSAS using our baselines. Transects were constructed outside of DSAS and later imported.

cntperp.cntorg: University of Hawaii Coastal Geology Group

procstep.procdesc:
The baseline feature class was exported from a personal geodatabase to a shapefile in ArcCatalog (v.9.3) by performing a right-mouse click on the data layer > export > to shapefile (single).
This process and all subsequent processes by Bradley Romine, University of Hawaii Coastal Geology.

The baseline shapefile was projected in ESRI's ArcToolbox (v.9.3) > Data Management Tools > Projections and Transformations > Feature > Project. Parameters: input projection - UTM zone 4N (NAD 83); output projection - geographic coordinates (WGS 84); transformation - NAD_1983_To_WGS_1984_3 (Hawaii).

enttyp.enttypd: Reference baseline used by the Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) to calculate rate-of-change statistics

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Field required by the Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) software. DSAS uses this value to determine the ordering sequence of transects when the baseline feature contains multiple segments. Individual segments are numbered sequentially alongshore.
Transect length measured in meters in UTM projection, zone 4N on NAD83 datum

digtinfo.formcont: This WinZip file contains the baseline shapefile for use generating transects within the Digital Shoreline Analysis System for the Kauai East coastal region from Papaa to Nawiliwili.

onlinopt.accinstr: Data are downloadable via the World Wide Web (WWW).

distinfo.techpreq: This zip file contains data available in Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) polyline shapefile format. The user must have ArcGIS or ArcView 3.0 or greater software to read and process the data file. In lieu of ArcView or ArcGIS, the user may utilize another GIS application package capable of importing the data. A free data viewer, ArcExplorer, capable of displaying the data is available from ESRI at www.esri.com.
